text.0: gods whatsoeer the dove came hither seeking sent to us as the envoy of destruction.
text.1: for that let us sing hymns and make atonement well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.
text.2: auspicious be the dove that hath been sent us a harmless bird ye gods within our dwelling.
text.3: may agni sage be pleased with our oblation and may the missile borne on wings avoid us.
text.4: let not the arrow that hath wings distract us beside the fireplace on the hearth it settles.
text.5: may it bring welfare to our men and cattle here let the dove ye gods forbear to harm us.
text.6: the screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the dove hath settled.
text.7: to him who sent it hither as an envoy to him be reverence paid to death to yama.
text.8: drive forth the dove chase it with holy verses rejoicing bring ye hither food and cattle.
text.9: barring the way against all grief and trouble let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.
